alert.note: Alert for Northampton (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 04 at 9:02PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Northampton County through 945 PM EDT... At 902 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles north of Cheriton, or 9 miles north of Cape Charles, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Cape Charles, Nassawadox, Cheriton, Bay View, Eastville, Capeville, Birdsnest, Kiptopeke State Park, Jamesville, Silver Beach, Machipongo, Wardtown, Franktown, Simpkins, Townsend, Oyster, Cheapside, Kiptopeke, Plantation and Dalbys. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
